title: Shadow Gambit: The Cursed Crew
review: Yet another excellent stealth tactics game from this studio, hopefully not the last one ever. Great variety of characters each uniquely equipped to deal with each mission in a different way that it feels reasonably fresh to replay the missions with different characters, engaging and interesting story and two great DLCs to top it all off.

title: Shadow Gambit: The Cursed Crew
review: Same maps and enemy positions over and over, sooo boring. Love Shadow Tactics and Desperados 3 as they provided lots of unique puzzles, but this game's gameplay is much differ.

title: Shadow Gambit: The Cursed Crew
review: The DEV went out on a high note.   The main game and DLCs are a great example of this type of gameplay.

title: Shadow Gambit: The Cursed Crew
review: the best game ever. its been 35 years that im playing games. it was one of the best games you can buy and play. thanks mimimi

title: Shadow Gambit: The Cursed Crew
review:
I enjoy most stealth games. This is yet another one. Story wise, not my first choice, I preferred Desperados more. But it's similar gameplay and always looking for new challenges.
Somehow the graphics are nicer than other games, but at the same time I find it more distracting.

title: Shadow Gambit: The Cursed Crew
review: I enjoyed this game. I love the pace of the game, game mechanics and characters. It was cool until "All Part of the Legend" mission. Even after I cleared out all guards on the map it was not complete. Some posts mentioned it is because of the bug when you use Pinkus on that mission. I had Pinkus in my team too, so I assume I faced the same issue. Shame that the bug was not fixed.

title: Shadow Gambit: The Cursed Crew
review:
Shadow Gambit is Mimimi's crowning achievement. Made in the rather niche genre of stealth strategy this game has you take a crew of pirates across several isles and spy on and assassinate the inquisition. Each character has two abilities which can be highly different from the others; for example Suleidy can spawn a bush to give you cover to hide in almost anywhere. This allows you to find different angles of attack and take care of bodies easily. Meanwhile Toya can place a beacon in a small radius around him, and then teleport back to it from anywhere. Really useful when trying to infiltrate a centralized position as you can place the beacon in a bush, sneak in, shank a guy, then teleport to the exact opposite side of said compound while the inquisition fruitlessly searches for you. 
A big risk this game takes is with its openness. After the first three missions to get your sea legs under you, you have a choice of which of the several islands to go to next. Additionally, if that wasn't enough, after you get the first character, Afia Manticato, you have a choice of two, and then after that, all the rest. Desperadoes 3 and Shadow Tactics, Mimimi's previous games in this genre, had each character limited to certain missions and the missions were in a set order. While I have heard complaints that this causes each mission to be unable to be made with exact characters in mind, I think there is much to be gained from the many choices available. I wouldn't want it to be done with every game in this genre, but I applaud Mimimi for taking this risk. 
The characters have interesting personalities, and varying backstories. From Gaelle who accidentally shot out her stomach with a cannon ball, to Toya's belief that cooking is a war he doesn't intend to lose, each of them are larger than life. 
There are also two dlcs, one of which reintroduces Yuki from Shadow Tactics, and the other Zagan, who has some interesting abilities. He can render enemies catatonic from range, but it costs him a hit point. No matter, his base melee attack restores a hit point. Very interesting use of health as a resource, in a game where you don't have much of it.

title: Shadow Gambit: The Cursed Crew
review:
The previous games were so much better. Especially the character and level design. 
Play Desperados 3 or Shadow Tactics if you like the genre.

There might be a specific reason why the design took a turn for the worse and the company went out of business after realeasing this game but I can't quite put my finger on it

title: Shadow Gambit: The Cursed Crew
review: Mimimi are so good at this type of games. Love the variety on the characters and the theme is very well executed.

title: Shadow Gambit: The Cursed Crew
review:
It is the same game as the previous entries (Desperados 3 and Shadow Gambit), only with far more abilities and content

If you liked the previous, this one is worth it for sure

title: Shadow Gambit: The Cursed Crew
review:
Mimimi has refined and expanded the gameplay and flexibility in how you play it but in the process have somewhat lost on the cohesiveness of the story compared to Shadow Tactics and Desperadoes 3.

I'm a bit disappointed by the music compared to the previous games.  The previous games were excellent but Shadow Gambit has some tracks that start to wear a bit thin after a while.

It's still a good game and well worth playing but  its predecessors were more to my taste.

title: Shadow Gambit: The Cursed Crew
review:
In Shadow of the Shogun you are Samurai, you fight aganist the bad Samurai 

In Desperadoes III you are cowboys, you fight aganist the bad Cowboys

In Shadow Gambit you are pirates, you fight aganist the Imperium of Mathkind

title: Shadow Gambit: The Cursed Crew
review: More genius worldbuilding, voice direction and RT strategy like its predecessor Desperados III.

title: Shadow Gambit: The Cursed Crew
review:
Fun story line!
but need better gameplay / UI. and guide on how to get further.

title: Shadow Gambit: The Cursed Crew
review:
Kinda meh. Can't force myself to play this game anymore. I am pretty ok with inclusion, but all the main characters are women (even the freaking skull) making their soft voices "scary" with these "cool" (and long) dialogues because yeah, it's a pirate game, women are tough and so on. So, can't take it serious, too childish or women-oriented. You really want to see a strong woman character? Play the first game. It was released many years ago, but the story is way better than this (but the graphics remained the same, cool right?). Well, I don't know why Mimimi was shut down, but at this point I am not even interested. Would have bought this game with 90% discount, but never for a full price.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3338820879

title: Shadow Gambit: The Cursed Crew
Shadow Gambit: The Cursed Crew
review: but the controls and the camera make ....nearly unplayable for me as i only have one working  arm. The camera will also get stuck in a position where  you can't get a good position to actually see what's going on because you can't see what the rest of the level looks like

10/10 Awsome Game!
